means: 指说话人与听者已知的人（物）
用于独一无二的事物前
与形容词最高级和序数词连用
Technical Help to Exporters <英>出口商的技术协助

sentence.Network_en: The best thing to do when entering unknown territory is smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 踏入未知地带最好的对策就是微笑。

sentence.Network_en: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are stronger at the broken places.
sentence.Network_cn: 生活总是让我们遍体鳞伤，但到后来，那些受伤的地方会变得更坚强。

sentence.Network_en: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys. Make your lives extraordinary.
sentence.Network_cn: 人生就应该是快乐的，要抓住每一天，孩子们，让你们的生活变得非凡起来。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 七年级（上）英语单词表一. ... 171 look v 看上去,显得 172 the art 这(那)个,这(那)些 173 same adj 同样的,同一的.
广州版小学三年级_百度文库 ... bag 包;袋子 the 这(定冠词) Unit 8 pack 包扎;收拾.
小学一至五年级英语单词_百度知道 ... that 那个 the 那，这（冠词） there 那里（指远处）.

the consistency of the Big M Method and Two-Phase Method in idea , auxiliary linear programming problem , initial feasible basis , initial simplex tableau and optimality criterion , etc . , is analyzed .摘要分析了大M法与两阶段法在思想方法、辅助线性规划问题的构造、初始可行基、初始单纯形表、最优性检验和算法

list.abs: 高考英语听力习语必备 ... the other day 几天前 the sooner the better 越快越好 this is my treat 我请客.
How&nbsp;I&nbsp;me... ... 15. a tough sell 艰巨的任务 16. the more the merrier 多多益善,(人)越多越热闹 18. taste bud 味蕾.
er Tijiao the history of the family hand-made workshop production , production of high season or low season .历史上二踢脚制作为家庭手工作坊生产，生产有旺季淡季之分。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English se, sēo, thæt, ultimately superseded by forms from Northumbrian and North Mercian thē, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch de, dat, and German der, die, das

encyclopedia.content: 定冠词，用法： 定冠词the具有确定的意思，用以特指人或事物，表示名词所指的人或事物是同类中的特定的一个，以别于同类中其他的人或事物，相当于汉语中的“那个”或“这个”的意思。它可以和单、复数名词，也可以和不可数的名词连用。用在以辅音音素开头的词前读e? ，用在以元音音素开头的词前读ei ,在特别强调时读ei:。又是一个计算机系统的名称。

entry.tran: (用于名词短语之前，指代已经提及或指明的人或物)
entry.def: You use the at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.

example.ex: A waiter came and hovered. John caught my look and we both got up and, ignoring the waiter, made our way to the buffet...
example.tran: 一个侍者走了过来，候在附近。约翰领会了我的眼神，我们两个都站了起来，没有理睬那个侍者，朝自助餐台走去。

example.ex: Six of the 38 people were Russian citizens.
example.tran: 38 个人中有 6 个是俄罗斯公民。

entry.tran: (当名词后接 of 短语或表明身份的从句时，该名词前用the)
entry.def: You use the at the beginning of a noun group when the first noun is followed by an 'of' phrase or a clause which identifies the person or thing.

example.ex: There has been a slight increase in the consumption of meat...
example.tran: 肉类消费量略有增长。

example.ex: Of the 9,660 cases processed last year, only 10 per cent were totally rejected.
example.tran: 去年受理的 9,660 宗案件中，只有 10% 被完全驳回。

entry.tran: (用于某些表示人们共有经历的名词前)
entry.def: You use the in front of some nouns that refer to something in our general experience of the world.

example.ex: It's always hard to speculate about the future...
example.tran: 未来一向很难预测。

example.ex: Amy sat outside in the sun...
example.tran: 埃米坐在外面太阳底下。

entry.tran: (用于和日常生活相关的人、物、服务、机构的名词前)
entry.def: You use the in front of nouns that refer to people, things, services, or institutions that are associated with everyday life.

example.ex: The doctor's on his way...
example.tran: 医生正在路上。

example.ex: Who was that on the phone?...
example.tran: 刚才打电话的是谁啊？

entry.tran: (用于代替所有格限定词，尤在谈论身体某一部分或家庭某一成员时)
entry.def: You use the instead of a possessive determiner, especially when you are talking about a part of someone's body or a member of their family.

example.ex: 'How's the family?' — 'Just fine, thank you.'...
example.tran: “家里人都好吧？”——“都好，谢谢。”

example.ex: I patted him on the head...
example.tran: 我拍了拍他的头。

entry.tran: (用于单数名词前，表示一类人或事物)
entry.def: You use the in front of a singular noun when you want to make a general statement about things or people of that type.

example.ex: An area in which the computer has made considerable strides in recent years is in playing chess...
example.tran: 近年来，计算机应用取得长足进步的一个领域是国际象棋。

example.ex: After dogs, the horse has had the closest relationship with man.
example.tran: 除了狗以外，就数马和人的关系最密切了。

entry.tran: (谈论是否会演奏乐器时，用于乐器名称前)
entry.def: You use the with the name of a musical instrument when you are talking about someone's ability to play the instrument.

example.ex: Did you play the piano as a child?...
example.tran: 你小时候弹过钢琴吗？

example.ex: She was trying to teach him to play the guitar.
example.tran: 她在试着教他弹吉他。

entry.tran: (用于表示国籍的形容词和名词以谈论一国全体国民)
entry.def: You use the with nationality adjectives and nouns to talk about the people who live in a country.

example.ex: The Japanese, Americans, and even the French and Germans, judge economic policies by results.
example.tran: 日本人、美国人，甚至法国人和德国人，都依据结果来评判经济政策的好坏。

entry.tran: (与 rich, poor, old, unemployed 等形容词连用，表示某一类人)
entry.def: You use the with words such as 'rich', 'poor', 'old', or 'unemployed' to refer to all people of a particular type.

example.ex: Conditions for the poor in Los Angeles have not improved.
example.tran: 洛杉矶穷人的境况仍未得到改善。

example.ex: ...care for the elderly and the disabled.
example.tran: 对老人和残疾人的照顾

entry.tran: (用于姓氏的复数前，表示一家人或夫妻)
entry.def: If you want to refer to a whole family or to a married couple, you can make their surname into a plural and use the in front of it.

example.ex: ...a 400 acre farm owned by the Allens...
example.tran: 艾伦家的一个面积为 400 英亩的农场

example.ex: The Taylors decided that they would employ an architect to do the work.
example.tran: 泰勒家决定雇个建筑师来干这个活。

entry.tran: (用于形容词前，表示其修饰的某个事物)
entry.def: You use the in front of an adjective when you are referring to a particular thing that is described by that adjective.

example.ex: He knows he's wishing for the impossible...
example.tran: 他清楚他在期盼一件不可能发生的事。

example.ex: I thought you might like to read the enclosed.
example.tran: 我想你或许想要读一下信封里的内容。

entry.tran: (表示拥有为某一特定目的所需的足够的某物)
entry.def: You use the to indicate that you have enough of the thing mentioned for a particular purpose.

example.ex: She may not have the money to maintain or restore her property...
example.tran: 她可能没有足够的钱来维护或修葺她的房产。

example.ex: We must have the patience to continue to work until we will find a peaceful solution...
example.tran: 我们一定要耐下心来继续努力，直到找出和平的解决方案为止。

entry.tran: (与某些称号、地名和其他名称连用)
entry.def: You use the with some titles, place names, and other names.

example.ex: The company was alleged to have leaked the news to the Daily Mail.
example.tran: 据称，那家公司将消息透露给了《每日邮报》。

example.ex: ...the Albert Hall...
example.tran: 艾伯特音乐厅

entry.def: You use the in front of numbers such as first, second, and third.

example.ex: The meeting should take place on the fifth of May...
example.tran: 会议将会于 5 月 5 日举行。

example.ex: Marco Polo is said to have sailed on the Pacific on his way to Java in the thirteenth century...
example.tran: 据说，13 世纪时，马可·波罗在去爪哇岛的途中在太平洋上航行过。

entry.def: You use the in front of numbers when they refer to decades.

example.ex: It's sometimes hard to imagine how bad things were in the thirties.
example.tran: 有时很难想象 30 年代的日子有多么困难。

entry.tran: (用于形容词和副词的最高级前)
entry.def: You use the in front of superlative adjectives and adverbs.

example.ex: Brisk daily walks are still the best exercise for young and old alike...
example.tran: 不管年轻人还是老人，每天快步行走仍是最好的锻炼方式。

example.ex: The Mayor of West Berlin described the Germans as the happiest people in the world...
example.tran: 西柏林市长称德国人是世界上最幸福的人。

entry.tran: 越…越…(用于两个比较级前，表示其中一个随另一个发生量或质的变化)
entry.def: You use the in front of each of two comparative adjectives or adverbs when you are describing how one amount or quality changes in relation to another.

example.ex: The longer you have been in shape in the past, the quicker you will regain fitness in future...
example.tran: 过去健美身形保持的时间越长，将来身材恢复得就越快。

example.ex: The more confidence you build up in yourself, the greater are your chances of success.
example.tran: 树立的自信心越强，成功的把握就越大。

entry.tran: 每，一(表示速度、价格、度量等)
entry.def: When you express rates, prices, and measurements, you can use the to say how many units apply to each of the items being measured.

example.ex: New Japanese cars averaged 13 km to the litre in 1981...
example.tran: 1981 年，新型的日产汽车平均每升汽油能跑 13 千米。

example.ex: Some analysts predicted that the exchange rate would soon be $2 to the pound.
example.tran: 一些分析人士预测，英镑对美元的汇率将很快达到1:2。

entry.tran: (表示某人或某物是同类中最有名、最重要或最好的。口语中 the 要重读；书面语中常加下划线或用大写、斜体)
entry.def: You use the to indicate that something or someone is the most famous, important, or best thing of its kind. In spoken English, you put more stress on it, and in written English, you often underline it or write it in capitals or italics.

example.ex: Camden Market is the place to be on a Saturday or Sunday...
example.tran: 卡姆登市场是周末的最佳去处。

example.ex: 'Olympia is in America, where K Records was founded.' — 'No! Surely you don't mean THE K Records?'
example.tran: “奥林匹亚在美国，K 唱片公司就是在那里创立的。”——“不可能！你不会指那个大名鼎鼎的 K 唱片公司吧？”

list.explanation: 采取断然或激烈的行动

example.en: He jumped off the deep end and got married again.
example.zh: 他断然地采取了行动，并且再次结了婚。

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]法定的最长徒刑(常指终身监禁)

example.en: Lefty did the book for his part in the rubbery.
example.zh: 莱夫蒂因参与那起抢劫案而服无期徒刑。

list.explanation: (对付某人的)一套办法，决窍

example.en: The book on this player was to leave him alone, treat him politely, and pick him up if you happened to block him.
example.zh: 对付这位运动员的办法是不去惹他，对他客客气气；万一碍着他就向他赔个罪。*见hit the books

list.explanation: [无业游民用语]流浪街头无处过夜

example.en: I have carried the banner in in-fernal metropolises.
example.zh: 我曾在一些地狱般的大都市整夜流浪街头。

list.explanation: 外国话

example.en: You sure do have a mouth full of the bat.
example.zh: 你的确是满口外国腔。

list.explanation: 大肆铺张，摆阔，摆架子

example.en: Frank's really putting on the dog for the big party Friday night.
example.zh: 弗兰克为了星期五晚上的那个大聚会，可真是大肆铺张。

list.explanation: 大量，许许多多

example.en: We have old magazines out the gazoo here. Can't we throw some of them away?
example.zh: 我们这里有好多旧杂志。难道我们不能把它们扔掉几本吗？

list.explanation: 到处，每个地方

example.en: Go away. I have problems our the gazoo. I don't need any more of them from you.
example.zh: 你们走吧。我的问题到处都是。我不想你们再来添乱。

list.explanation: 被逮捕

example.en: Bruno and Tony pulled the job off together,but Tony took the fall.
example.zh: 那事是布鲁诺和托尼一起干的，可是托尼被捕了。

list.explanation: 酗酒，狂饮作乐

example.en: She won't be able to return your call. I'm afraid she's on the juice again.
example.zh: 她不会给你回电的。我担心她又酗酒了。

list.explanation: 秘藏的王牌，秘而不露的髙招

example.en: The lawyer's ace in the hole was a secret witness who had seen the accident.
example.zh: 那律师手中的王牌是一个目睹那次事件的秘密人证。

list.explanation: 上街示威，把本来属于私下的矛盾问题张扬出去

example.en: The debate was quiet for a time, then they took it to the street.
example.zh: 那场争论有一段时间外界并不知逍,他们到后来才闹出来让人知道的。

example.en: Come on, don't take it to the street!
example.zh: 千万千万，不要张扬出去!

list.explanation: 走上大街，上街散步

example.en: I have a long way to go, I'd better hit the bricks.
example.zh: 我要走很长一段路呢，我还是走吧。

example.en: Go on! Hit the pavemem! Get going!
example.zh: 快点!上街去!走吧!

list.explanation: [监狱用语]被释放，出狱

example.en: He'll hit the bricks tomorrow，having been paroled.
example.zh: 他已经获得假释，明天就出狱。

list.explanation: 罢工

example.en: Agree to our demands, or we hh the bricks.
example.zh: 答应我们的要求，否则我们就罢工。

list.explanation: (向某人)献股勤、拍马屁、讨好

example.en: Tom is trying to curry below the knee with the boss to get a promotion.
example.zh: 为了获得提升，汤姆正在想方设法讨好他的上司。

list.explanation: 受到责罚、申斥、粗暴对待、虐待

example.en: When they found out his record he got the business.
example.zh: 他们一查清广他的底细，他就挨整了。

list.explanation: 以训诫或惩罚进行要挟某人

example.en: Why can' t Mayor Barry put the wood to school administrators and demand more caring than this?
example.zh: 为什么巴里市长不能以训诫方式要求学校当局多一点关注呢?

list.explanation: 不理睬某人，对某人冷淡

example.en: She was pretty snooty till we all put the chill on her.
example.zh: 她可真是高傲自大极了，直弄得我们大家都不理睬她。

example.en: I sent him a real snorter, because he really quite put the chill on me.
example.zh: 我寄给他一封措同极为严厉的信，因为他对我实在太冷淡了。

list.explanation: 杀死某人

example.en: Moyer had the chill put on Stein.
example.zh: 莫耶尔雇人杀死了斯坦因。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)匆匆或赶紧离开、离去

example.en: Come on, let's blow the joint before there's trouble.
example.zh: 快走，在出麻烦之前我们赶紧离开这儿。

example.en: They blew the joint about an hour ago.
example.zh: 他们在大概一小时前匆匆走了。

list.explanation: (军队用语)(常用于命令式)别发牢骚了。我帮不了你忙

example.en: Stop telling me your troubles because I am not interested ；go and see the chaplain.
example.zh: 别再向我叹你的苦经了, 我不感兴趣,你走吧，我帮不了你忙。

list.explanation: 把某事物暂搁一边

example.en: You put it in the hopper. Let's get this done!
example.zh: 你把这暂搁一边。让我们来完成吧!

list.explanation: 遭受重大经济损失，破产

example.en: These investors had been taken to the cleaners.
example.zh: 这些投资者都遭受到了重大经济损失。

list.explanation: 加速(某人或某事的)衰败或成功

example.en: When your time comes, you bastard, I hope I can grease the skids.
example.zh: 我盼着等你这杂种遭报应时，再给你火上浇油。

example.en: We need someone to grease the skids for the Wilson contract.
example.zh: 我们需要有个人助一臂之力，促使威尔逊这个合同成功。

list.explanation: 接近完成，到最后关头

example.en: We went right down to the wire on that one.
example.zh: 那一项工作我们已经快完成了。

example.en: It came down to the wire before I turned the proposal in.
example.zh: 我提交计划的最后时刻终于来临了。

list.explanation: 另一半人的生活如何(指另一半是穷人或富人)

example.en: Now I am beginning to understand how the other half lives.
example.zh: 如今我正在开始了解另外一半人的生活如何。

list.explanation: (大学生用语)在厕所呕吐

example.en: I think I'd better go home and pray to the porcelain god.
example.zh: 我想我还是回家吐在马桶里的好。

list.explanation: 破坏，制止

example.en: The orchestra put that dance number on the fritz.
example.zh: 乐队把那个舞蹈节目给弃砸了。

list.explanation: (警察和黑社会用语)在磨烊工的，在偷懒的，未经许可而下班休息的

example.en: The cruise car for that street was in the coop.
example.zh: 那条街上的巡逻车在偷懒没出动。

list.explanation: 包庇某人，为某人开脱责任

example.en: He falls for Uona and winds up trying to get her off the hook.
example.zh: 他爱上了伊洛娜，最后竟想包庇她过关。

list.explanation: (军队用语)被复杂、琐碎、无谓的事纠缠得脱不了身的

example.en: He was involved in their messy troubles and got wrapped around the axle.
example.zh: 他被卷进了他们那些乱七八糟的纠纷里，弄得脱不了身。

list.explanation: 浪费时间，闲荡，拖延

example.en: We had better quit screwing the pooch and get cracking.
example.zh: 我们最好快点干，别再浪费时间了。

list.explanation: 按正规步骤(如按规定、法律、合同等)

example.en: He said there would be no more cor-ner cutting. we'd do everything strictly by the book.
example.zh: 他说今后不能再抄近就简，一切务必严格照章办理。

list.explanation: (源出赛马用语)在最后(冲剌)阶段

example.en: We're in the homestretch with this project and can't change it now.
example.zh: 我们是在实施这一计划的最后阶段，现在可不能更改。

example.en: We're in the stretch. Only three more days till we graduate.
example.zh: 我们现是最后冲刺阶段。再有三天的时间我们就毕业了。

list.explanation: 服用毒品

example.en: Is Tracy hitting the dope again?
example.zh: 特雷西又在吸毒了？

list.explanation: 一切停止!请安静!

example.en: Stop the music!I have an announcement.
example.zh: 请安静!我有一个通知。

list.explanation: 作巡回政治演说，游说，演说

example.en: The men running for presidency were on the stump in their home states.
example.zh: 那些竞选总统的人在各自的家乡各州到处游说。

example.en: He is very effective on the stump.
example.zh: 他发衣演说很能打动人心。

list.explanation: 濒于破产

example.en: The company went on the rims.
example.zh: 那家公司已濒临破产了。

list.explanation: 临近终点，接近尾声

example.en: The project is coming up to the wire and we're a bit nervous.
example.zh: 这项工程现在正接近尾声，所以我们有点儿紧张。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)向某人敲诈、勒索钱财

example.en: The hooligan puts peddlers on the stake monthly.
example.zh: 那地头蛇按月向小贩们强索保护费。

list.explanation: 呕吐

example.en: Wayne laughed at the carpet, and people moved away-not knowing what he was going to do next.
example.zh: 韦恩呕吐了,而大家都走了——不知道他接下来会怎么样。

list.explanation: 具有最先进技术的

example.en: This gadget is brand new. It's really on the bleeding edge.
example.zh: 这玩意儿是一种新东西。它是真正具有最先进技术的。

list.explanation: 出发，离开(尤指某人在骑上马时) 离开

example.en: I have to hit the trail before sunset.
example.zh: 我必须在日落之前动身离开

list.explanation: 突然使某人极度惊恐

example.en: The piano lid fell and scared the pants off my parents.
example.zh: 钢琴盖突然倒了下来，把我的爹妈吓了一大跳。

slang.tokens: talk on the big white phone

list.explanation: 往抽水马桶里呕吐

example.en: One more beer and I'm gonna have to go talk on the big white phone.
example.zh: 再多喝一杯啤酒，我就非要跑到洗手间去呕吐不可怜。

list.explanation: (由于失望、 焦急或忧虑而)举止失常

example.en: By the time the cops came I was about to climb the wall.
example.zh: 警察赶到的时候，我都快急得发疯了。

example.en: He was at home for only three days, then he began to go up the wall.
example.zh: 他在家里只呆了三天，后来就开始坐立不安了。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)(聚会)瓜分掠夺物、分赃

example.en: All the gangsters will gather at their lair for cutting up the touches today.
example.zh: 今天所有匪徒都将在匪巢集合分赃。

list.explanation: 话旧，缅怀往事

example.en: The widow cuts up the pipes about her dead husband.
example.zh: 那寡妇在怀念她死去的丈夫。

list.explanation: 闲聊，随便说

example.en: I don't intend to cut up the jackpots.
example.zh: 我并不想无所事事地闲聊。

list.explanation: (青少年用语)高速驾驶

example.en: He bent the throttle at ninety.
example.zh: 他以 90 码的速度高速驾车。

list.explanation: (军队用语)焦虑，渴望

example.en: I'm leaning forward in the saddle for him to write me a good cheerful letter.
example.zh: 我热切渴望他给我写一封很开心的信。

list.explanation: 没有极限。无上限。不封顶。

example.en: I can afford it. The sky's the limit.
example.zh: 这个我负担得起。不封顶。(意指不管多少钱都行。)

list.explanation: 具有相同观点(的)，有问感(的)，相一致(的)，相互协调(的)，相互理解(的)

example.en: We're not on the same wavelength. Let's try again.
example.zh: 我们相互不协调。让我们再试试。

example.en: We kept talking until we were on the same wavelength.
example.zh: 我们继续交谈，直谈到我们相互理解为止。

example.en: Finding a restaurant on your wavelength is easy.
example.zh: 找一家合你胃口的餐馆并不难。

list.explanation: 欢闹，狂饮作乐

example.en: Your wife was in England,and you went on the razzle with Leo.
example.zh: 你的妻子在英国，于是你就同利奥一起去狂饮作乐了。

list.explanation: 知情的，熟悉内幕的，消息灵通的

example.en: Sure,I'm in the know. But I'm not telling.
example.zh: 当然，我熟知内情。不过现在我不能说。

example.en: Ask Harry. He's usually in the know.
example.zh: 请教哈里吧。 他总是消息很灵通。

list.explanation: (表示强调、惊讶、不耐烦、怀疑、沮丧等的感叹语)

example.en: I already did it,for the love of Pete!
example.zh: 嘿，瞧我已经干完了!

list.explanation: 走向穷困，开始堕落

example.en: Jed hit the skids when he started drugging.
example.zh: 杰德一始吸毒，就走堕落了。

list.explanation: 急剧下降，惨败

example.en: The business of our firm hit the skids when the dollar collapsed.
example.zh: 美元暴跌，我们公司的生意一落千丈。

example.en: Eventually they had hit the skids.
example.zh: 他们最终一败涂地。

list.explanation: 烈性酒，喝酒，酒癖

example.en: Once you've had the bottle，you'll never forget it.
example.zh: 你一旦喝了烈性酒，就永远也忘不了它了。

example.en: The old guy was fond of the bottle.
example.zh: 这老汉喜欢杯中物。

list.explanation: (男妓的)卖淫

slang.tokens: throw ones hat in the ring

list.explanation: 参加竞选(或竞赛、讨论)

example.en: The con claimed he needed parole so he coutd throw his hat in the ring for the mayoral election.
example.zh: 那囚犯要求假释，以使他能参加市长竞选。

list.explanation: 不再开玩笑，不再胡闹

example.en: Cut the comedy and get to work !
example.zh: 别再开玩笑啦，开始工作吧!

example.en: "I'll cut the comedy with you,"he said.
example.zh: 他说:"我不再跟你开玩笑了。"

list.explanation: 不起眼的小公司、企业、娱乐团体或体育组织

example.en: After six years in the small time she finally had a big hit and went to Broadway.
example.zh: 她在小剧团里呆了六年，终于一举成名，并且进了百老汇。

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]贪图受贿，贪赃枉法

example.en: Everyone in city halt is on the take.
example.zh: 市政厅里的人个个都接受贿赂。

example.en: I heard that the mayor was accused of being on the take.
example.zh: 听说，市长被控受贿。

list.explanation: 电视电视机

example.en: What's on the tube tonight?
example.zh: 今晚电视上播放什么？

example.en: The tube is in the shop, so I read a book.
example.zh: 电视机在店里，(家里没有电视机)所以我只好看书。

list.explanation: 那是个愚螽的问题。难道答案不是很清楚吗？(其反语的含意是别向我提这种愚蠢的问题。因前任教皇保罗二世是波兰人，乃妇孺皆知的问题。)

example.en: A: Tell me please, would it cause the skies to fall. B: Is the Pope Polish?
example.zh: 甲:请告诉我，那会使天坍下来叫？乙:真是个愚蠢的问题。

list.explanation: 背叛或出卖某人乘人之危

example.en: It's my considered opinion, Yurochka, we've been sold down the river.
example.zh: 尤洛奇卡，经过反复思考，我认为我们已经是被人出卖了。

list.explanation: a.情况良好的，达到水准的

example.en: He didn't feel up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他感到身体不大舒服。

list.explanation: ad. 十全十美，充分

example.en: He was prepared up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他作了最充分的准备。

list.explanation: 欺骗、蒙骗(某人)

example.en: The boss really gave Wally the shaft.
example.zh: 老板确实是欺骗了书利。

list.explanation: 怠慢、亏待、拒绝(某人)

example.en: Somebody always gives me the shaft.
example.zh: 有人总是冷落我。

example.en: She gave him the shaft after he broke their date last weekend.
example.zh: 他上周末失约后, 她就跟他吹了。

list.explanation: (自以为)什么都精通

example.en: That little creep over there always thinks he knows all the answers.
example.zh: 那边那个小家伙老是以为自己样样都通。

list.explanation: 无心过问，看透一切

example.en: She doesn't bother any more. She knows all the answers.
example.zh: 她不再烦恼，全都看透了。

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)彻底了解(一件事)

example.en: Even your doctor doesn't have all the answers.
example.zh: 你的病就连你的医生也并不完全了解呐。

list.explanation: 未解决的，未决定的，不肯定的，迟疑不决的

example.en: The question of who will attend is still up in the air.
example.zh: 关于谁出席的问题还悬而未决。

list.explanation: 十分恼火的，非常激动的

example.en: My father went straight up in the air when he heard I damaged the car.
example.zh: 父亲一听说我把车弄坏了，立即火冒三丈。

list.explanation: 走到极限.走极端.什么都干得出来

example.en: These people would unhesitatingly go the limit.
example.zh: 这些人会毫无顾忌地走极端。

list.explanation: 具体的内容、东西在哪儿呐？有具体的东西、实质内容吗？

example.en: That's really clever and appealing, but where's the beef?
example.zh: 那的确是十分机智、有感染力，可是具体内容呢？

example.en: Where's the beef？ There's no substance in this proposal.
example.zh: 实质内容在哪儿？在这份建议里没有实质性的东两。

list.explanation: 心情不安，尴尬处境，处于困境

example.en: The poor jerk's on the hot seat for for getting to shut the safe.
example.zh: 那可怜的傻瓜因忘了锁保险柜而坐立不安。

example.en: If you're in the hot seat, he'll fight for you.
example.zh: 假若你有闲难，他会出力相助的。

list.explanation: 使某人经受磨难或磨炼，使某人受折磨，严格测试某事物

example.en: She's quite eager to try again,although they really ran her through the mill.
example.zh: 虽然他们把她折腾得够呛，但她还是想再试一次。

example.en: The new car was put through the mill.
example.zh: 这辆新车经过了严格测试。

list.explanation: 狂怒，大发脾气

example.en: What's he looking so all hair by the nose about?
example.zh: 他为什么这样怒气冲天？

list.explanation: 愤怒的,疯狂的

example.en: At least,I don't know anybody who is up the wall about it.
example.zh: 至少我就不知道有谁在为此发疯。

list.explanation: 忧虑的，发愁的，心绪不好的

example.en: He' s really up the wall about Mary's illness.
example.zh: 他的确很为玛丽的病担忧。

list.explanation: 拒绝、冷落某人

example.en: Women are quick to put the freeze on freeloaders.
example.zh: 女人们很快会把那些白吃白喝的寄生虫甩掉的。

slang.tokens: Shit or get off the pot.

list.explanation: (常用于表示不满或提出要求)不能举棋不定。应当机立断

example.en: The union leader wamed that the city had until Feb. 1 to shit or get off the pot.
example.zh: 工会领抽警告说，市政当局在2月1日之前必须作出决定。

list.explanation: 把某人打得一败涂地，轻易地大败某人

example.en: That bum? The champ'll wipe up the floor with him.
example.zh: 那个家伙？冠军准会轻而易举地把他打得一败涂地。

example.en: Our team wiped the floor with the visiting team.
example.zh: 我队大胜了客队。

list.explanation: 使某人受尽折燃(尤指严加审问)，使某人历尽艰苦

example.en: Students asking for loans are really put through the wringer.
example.zh: 要求贷款的学生确实是备受刁难。

list.explanation: 野心勃勃的(地)，追名逐利的(地)，很有抱负的(地)，沽名钓誉的(地)

example.en: The rookies are very much on the make.
example.zh: 那些新来的人野心可不小。

example.en: She associated with men on the make.
example.zh: 她居然与追名逐利之辈为伍。

example.en: That young lawyer is sure on the make.
example.zh: 那位年轻律师肯定是很有抱负的。

list.explanation: 荒淫无度的(地)，求欢心切的(地)(指寻求性伴侣)

example.en: Whether they are on the make，and they all are.
example.zh: 不管他们是否荒淫无度，反正全是。

example.en: You mean he was still on the make? At his age?
example.zh: 你的意思是说，他还是在拼命地寻找性伴侣？在他这个年龄？

list.explanation: 处于受支配地位的，任人摆布的

example.en: The Criminal Justice Act would have all the villains under the cosh.
example.zh: 刑事审判法将使所有恶棍都俯首贴耳。

list.explanation: (对某事)变成十分协调、合适

example.en: I was uncomfortable at first, but now I'm beginning to get in the groove.
example.zh: 最初，我感到很别扭，可是现在我开始觉得顺畅了。

example.en: Fred began to get in the groove, and things went more smoothly.
example.zh: 弗雷德开始适应于是事情就进行得顺当多了。

list.explanation: (与…)斗殴、激烈竞争或争论

example.en: They soon stopped sparring and went to the mat.
example.zh: 他们刚吵了几句，接着就打起来了。

example.en: The union may go to the mat with the management over wages.
example.zh: 工会可能与资方就工资问题进行激烈争论。

list.explanation: 暴饮，狂饮

example.en: Well,I guess I'll go on the piss tonight.
example.zh: 好吧，我想今晚我会去狂饮一番。

list.explanation: 打毒品针成瘾的，有毒瘾的

example.en: Once your're on the needle, you've had it.
example.zh: 一旦你注射了毒品针，那就一定上瘾。

slang.tokens: Get the lead out！(=Shake the lead out!)

list.explanation: (表示要快速做事的命令语)

example.en: Get the lead out and start writing!
example.zh: 快点动手写吧!

example.en: Shake the lead out!I want it done today，not next week.
example.zh: 加紧干!我要它今天就完成，不要拖到下周。

list.explanation: (尤指在赛马中)作出极大努力，跑得很快

example.en: I suppose the chestnut horse will go for the doctor and get a huge win at this races.
example.zh: 我想那匹叫栗色马 一定会跑得很快,在 这次赛马会上准会大获成功。

list.explanation: 押大笔赌注，打赌

example.en: I'll go for tlie doctor thai he's there.
example.zh: 我敢打赌，他准在那儿。

list.explanation: (支付、价格等)超出预期的，高于必需的，过多的

example.en: He got two pounds over the odds for his job.
example.zh: 按他的活几来说,他多得了两英镑。

list.explanation: (行为、事件等)超出人们所能忍受的，不公平的，不合理的

example.en: I admit that to be called a damned Englishman by Pedro Gonsalvez is a bit over the odds.
example.zh: 我承认，被彼德罗·罔萨尔维兹骂作一个他妈的英国人是相当叫人难以容忍的。

list.explanation: 越狱逃跑的

example.en: He's out. Over the wall.
example.zh: 他出来了。越狱逃出来的。

list.explanation: 不受人欢迎的，与人或社会格格不入的

example.en: And you're on the outer for sticking up for him?
example.zh: 你为他辩护不合适吗？

list.explanation: 潜伏着起破坏作用的东西或人，潜在的障碍，隐患，可疑的情况，不可告人的目的

example.en: Without removing the nigger in the fence，there is no prospect of success.
example.zh: 不消除隐患是不会有希望成功的。

list.explanation: 利用一切可以利用的东西，继续全力以赴

example.en: Then the mayor decided to pull out all the stops.
example.zh: 于是市长作出决定，继续全力以赴。

list.explanation: 在潜逃中(的)，脱逃 (的)，被通缉(的)

example.en: So I went on the lam.
example.zh: 于是我被通缉了。

list.explanation: 到处旅行,流浪

example.en: The girl took it on the lam.
example.zh: 那姑娘带着那东西到处旅行。

list.explanation: 无保留地，完全地，自始至终

example.en: The door opened all the way.
example.zh: 门一直大开着。

example.en: He was all the way back to normal.
example.zh: 他完全恢复了正常。

list.explanation: (某人)处境危险、担风险

example.en: I better be right this time, because my ass is on the line.
example.zh: 这一回我可不能再搞错了，我担着风险呢。

list.explanation: (对生活或情况)熟悉的，了解的，知情的

example.en: As the days rolled on I commenced getting hep to the jive.
example.zh: 随着日子 一天一天过去，我开始懂得人情世故了。

auth_sentence.content: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.
auth_sentence.res_content: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.

auth_sentence.content: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.
auth_sentence.res_content: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Above the church a vulture specked the blue sky.

auth_sentence.content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 甲状腺激素测定,甲状腺激素计值

Sentence.sentence: Peering into the future G) The sharing economy is a little like online shopping, which started in America 15 years ago
i) The main worry is regulatory uncertainty
J) The sharing economy is the latest example of the internet's value to consumers.

A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.
Our behavior is changed The first copy right law in the United States was passed by congress in
A Nation That's Losing Its Toolbox The scene inside the Home Depot on Weyman Avenue here would give the old-time American craftsman pause

sentences.en: It's her room.The room is bright and clean.
sentences.cn: 这是她的房间。这房间明亮整洁。

means.word_mean: (指说话人与听者已知的人[物])

sentences.en: The sun is like a great ball of fire.

means.word_mean: (与形容词最高级和序数词连用)

sentences.en: September is the ninth month of the year.
sentences.cn: 九月是一年中的第九个月。

sentences.en: This is the best book I have ever read.
sentences.cn: 这是我看过的最好的一本书。

means.word_mean: (在单数名词前表示一类人[物])

sentences.en: The horse is a useful animal.
The Pacific Ocean is the biggest ocean in the earth.
sentences.cn: 太平洋是地球上最大的海洋。

sentences.en: He is good at the piano.
The worker is paid by the hour.
sentences.cn: 这个工人的工资按小时计算。

sentences.en: The old are apt to catch a cold.

jushi.english: The worker is paid by the hour.
jushi.chinese: 这个工人的薪资按小时计算。

jushi.english: This is the best book I have ever read.
jushi.chinese: 这是我所看过最好的一本书。

jushi.english: There are 16 ounces to the pound.
